COVID-19 Situation Report: 05 May 2022









View

 b12013031.pdf



Download

 b12013031.pdf (365.3Kb)





Published2022-05

Author(s)/Corporate Author (s)
United Nations. Economic Commission for Africa; United Nations. Economic Commission for Africa; 



Share

 Facebook


 Twitter


 Linkedin



Metadata
Show full item record







Abstract
The daily COVID-19 update 05 May 2022. 39 new confirmed COVID-19 cases were reported in the last 24 hours (positivity rate of 1.1%) bringing the total confirmed cases to 470,686 as of 05 May 2022. 0 new deaths reported adding to total 7,510 deaths reported since the beginning of the outbreak with a case fatality rate of 1.59%. 455,720 (96%) cases have recovered, however 10 confirmed cases are undergoing treatment in treatment centers of which 5 are severe. 3,579 RT-PCR and Ag-RDT tests were conducted in the last 24 hours, giving a cumulative 4,804,225 RT-PCR and Ag-RDT tests conducted. Still a variant of concern (VOC) as designated earlier and has been detected in the country.  Evidence from both laboratory and surveillance data have indicated that Omicron more transmissible than previous VOCs.  Vaccines provide a high level of protection against severe disease and death caused by VOCs.


Citation
“United Nations. Economic Commission for Africa; United Nations. Economic Commission for Africa (2022-05). COVID-19 Situation Report: 05 May 2022. COVID-19 Situation Report:. 666, 4 p.: ill., map.. Addis Ababa:. © UN. ECA,. https://hdl.handle.net/10855/49045”

The daily COVID-19 update 05 May 2022. 39 new confirmed COVID-19 cases were reported in the last 24 hours (positivity rate of 1.1%) bringing the total confirmed cases to 470,686 as of 05 May 2022. 455,720 (96%) cases have recovered, however 10 confirmed cases are undergoing treatment in treatment centers of which 5 are severe. https://hdl.handle.net/10855/49045”
